author: Bushido21XX

text:
Desu doesn't really mean something specifically.  It's a word that ends a sentence that has been derived from another verb and yadda yadda.  So think of desu as more of a way to end a sentence rather than a form of "is" or another verb.
Ok desu ka?  Would most literally translate to "Is it ok?"  The specific subject is ambiguous but in context we can see they are talking about "this" in reference to the collection of names you put in so it has the meaning of "Is this ok?" or "Is all of this ok?"

author: electricmastro

text:
Wow, am I the only one who heard "Okay sa" as in "okay sir"?  I always thought that's what it was saying.  

Anyway, I spent SO MUCH time on this screen thinking of names for everyone (and every thing).  I still haven't gone back and played this again after my first time.  I expected it to be out on the virtual console by now, but I've lost all hope that anyone actually cares about anything Earthbound/Mother in America anymore.  No Mother 3, and no Earthbound on VC.  I don't know what to do.

author: Jesse

text: @geophyzix2010  Well, thatÂ´s not quite right. In Japanese the word "desu" is a particle commonly used at the end of sentences to indicate the conclusion of your affirmative. But you are right about the "ka", so the sentence "OK desu ka" literally means "OK?", just that.
